column4: Our nation faces real challenges because of the coronavirus pandemic and its economic consequences. We need serious competent leadership to address these issues and that means we need a new Speaker of the House. https://t.co/6spELJX7qf

I applaud the announcement by @USDA to deliver high-speed broadband to rural Wyoming communities. This investment will empower our rural hospitals, schools, ranches, farms, & banks to better serve the people of Wyoming as we recover from the pandemic. https://t.co/293dWaqmxO

At every opportunity since the start of the pandemic, @SpeakerPelosi has chosen the partisan approach over actually getting something done for the American people. Listen to my full interview with KFBC's "Cheyenne Today": https://t.co/c92pszFgl3 https://t.co/xqFDUmTttW

House Democrats have a choice to make: will they continue to support @SpeakerPelosi's efforts to block COVID relief for Americans that need it, or will they sign @HerreraBeutler's discharge petition extending the Paycheck Protection Program for small businesses? #FightForSmallBiz https://t.co/HVbh6H2hWZ

It was great to talk with members of the Cheyenne Chamber of Commerce and provide an update on COVID-19 relief at Wednesday's virtual Wyoming Business & Industry Federation's annual fly-In. https://t.co/PSVKNI7Lsf https://t.co/MIhiPtyjKm

I always enjoy spending time with @GovernorGordon and had a chance to meet with him this week to discuss COVID relief, energy issues important to our state, and the Mountain West Conference. https://t.co/w1DwPDwtrk

On Monday, I spoke on the House floor in support of multiple pieces of legislation that are critical for tribal communities including grants for school health insurance, child protection programs, and business incubators for tribal startups. Learn more: https://t.co/jECLcFhs6x

According to Speaker Pelosi:

Brokering a historic agreement between Israel & Bahrain = a "distraction"

Holding China accountable for COVID19 = a "diversion"

You can always count on Speaker Pelosi to put her own political agenda before the safety of the American people.

The Senate is voting today on a COVID-19 relief package that provides targeted aid for families and small businesses. Unfortunately for the American people, Speaker Pelosi is still holding relief legislation hostage so that she can pass her partisan wish list. https://t.co/as4aptOLom

Through the China Task Force, House Republicans are taking the lead in holding the CCP accountable for unleashing COVID-19 on the world. It's shameful that Speaker Pelosi refuses to work with us while promoting CCP propaganda. Why is she protecting them? https://t.co/JNzjS7mo8c

The Paycheck Protection Program has proven to be a lifeline for Wyoming small businesses during the pandemic supporting 55,301 jobs at 12,210 businesses across our state. PPP loans are critical to restoring our economy. https://t.co/KrcVUtSNgS

Monday's House Oversight hearing wasn't about saving the USPS. The facts show that USPS is properly funded. This was a fabricated attack by Speaker Pelosi for political purposes, even though she's still holding COVID-19 relief hostage in an effort to pass her partisan wishlist. https://t.co/plGDkFrljX

Instead of abusing their power by passing bills with proxy votes to deal with a phony post office crisis, Speaker Pelosi and House Democrats ought to deal with the relief from the pandemic American families really need.  https://t.co/pflx9NxWJg

Just like Joe Biden, House Democrats are hiding.

They have no accomplishments to talk about and they can't defend Speaker Pelosi's failed leadership.

Republicans will defeat the virus, get our economy going, and protect our national security: https://t.co/LKe7IzfB2J https://t.co/60spXxDfgi

Socialism has a chokehold on the Democratic Party and their policies will prevent us from having an economic recovery. 

Republicans will build on the successes we saw before the pandemic and get people back to work: https://t.co/LKe7IyY0bb https://t.co/TyCF9puksR

Americans across the country are sick and tired of Speaker Pelosi's cynical approach that puts her far-left political agenda before the best interest of our nation. https://t.co/eOwXAORClp https://t.co/wtpf6b23Dl

These latest COVID-19 negotiations are just another example where Speaker Pelosi has refused to work in a bipartisan way to do what's right for the country. https://t.co/eOwXAOA1tR https://t.co/5OASICQWGV

The Paycheck Protection Program has supported over 50 million jobs during the COVID-19 pandemic. This includes support for 13,231 small businesses in Wyoming. PPP funds continue to be a lifeline for small businesses and their workers. Learn more here: https://t.co/EXjNhT1drV https://t.co/3L38VkHwYJ

Yesterday, @SpeakerPelosi said that efforts to hold China accountable for spreading COVID-19 are “a diversion.”

A real diversion was when she consumed the House Intel Committee with impeachment instead of focusing on global threats, including the pandemic threat from China: https://t.co/6LjsBn3ysM

I have instructed staff in my office and in House GOP Conference office to begin working from home. I will continue to work at the Capitol as we have votes, but we need to do everything we can to slow transmission of this virus & reduce numbers of people who could be exposed.
